macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Indian Sensex Slips Over 350 Points as Markets Pause Amid RBI Rate Decision Wait
items.summary: BSE Sensex fell over 350 points and Nifty traded in a narrow range on Wednesday, pausing after a rally from the India-US trade deal, as investors await RBI interest rate decision on Friday. Asian markets dropped, with MSCI Asia ex-Japan down 1.8% and Nikkei falling 1%.

items.title: US Stock Market Trades at 5% Discount to Fair Value, Growth and Small-Caps Attractive
items.summary: As of January 29, 2026, the US equity market is at a 5% discount to Morningstar's fair value estimates, with growth stocks and small-caps especially attractive amid fair value increases in commodities and late-cycle tech. Technology sector deepened to 16% discount while consumer defensive rose to 17% premium.

items.title: S&P 500 Software Sector Erases $830 Billion in Value Amid Six-Session Decline
items.summary: S&P 500 software and services index fell another 0.73% on Wednesday after a 4% rout on Tuesday, marking six straight declines and wiping out $830 billion since January 28 due to high valuations and rotation out of tech.

items.title: Mixed Global Futures Signals: S&P 500 Up, Hang Seng Down Ahead of Asian Open
items.summary: S&P 500 futures rose 0.3%, Japan's Topix up 0.4%, but Hang Seng futures fell 1.2%, Australia's ASX 200 down 0.2%, and Euro Stoxx 50 futures off 0.1%, reflecting cautious sentiment.

items.title: Bank of Japan Bond Yield Spike Triggers Global Volatility, US Stocks Dip 2% Then Recover
items.summary: Mid-January spike in Japanese government bond yields caused risk-off sentiment, sending US stocks down 2%, but apparent intervention calmed markets; expected higher volatility in 2026.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Loses $500 Billion in Week as Bitcoin Plummets 20%
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market shed nearly $500 billion in value over the past week, with Bitcoin falling approximately 20% and Ethereum declining 29.32%. The global crypto market capitalization dropped 6.47% to $2.42 trillion, driven by geopolitical tensions and cautious buyer sentiment despite the U.S. government ending its partial shutdown.

items.title: Bitcoin Hits 14-Month Low Near $72,000 Amid Safe-Haven Narrative Collapse
items.summary: Bitcoin tumbled to levels unseen since 2024, briefly dropping below $72,000 before recovering slightly. The decline has raised questions about Bitcoin's role as 'digital gold' and safe-haven asset, particularly as rising geopolitical tensions have failed to support the cryptocurrency's price.

items.title: Regulatory Impasse: Clarity Act Stalls as Banks and Crypto Companies Clash Over Stablecoin Rules
items.summary: The Clarity Act, a major crypto regulatory framework, has hit an impasse following a failed White House meeting. Disagreements between banks and crypto companies over stablecoin interest rewards led Coinbase to withdraw support, escalating tensions between Wall Street and the crypto industry.

items.title: Stifel Analysts Warn Bitcoin Could Fall to $38,000 if Headwinds Persist
items.summary: Wall Street analysts predict Bitcoin could trade as low as $38,000 during the current cycle if multiple negative factors continue. The cryptocurrency briefly broke below $73,000 this week, signaling potential for further downside.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Expert Intelligence Secures $5.8M Seed Funding for AI Lab Automation
items.summary: AI startup Expert Intelligence raised $5.8 million in seed funding led by Sierra Ventures to automate regulated laboratory workflows in drug development using its Limited Sample Model, which interprets large datasets with chemist-level accuracy while complying with FDA guidelines.

items.title: UN Secretary-General Proposes 40-Member Independent AI Scientific Panel
items.summary: UN Secretary-General submitted a list of 40 global experts to the General Assembly for the new Independent International Scientific Panel on AI, aimed at closing knowledge gaps, assessing impacts, and informing governance amid rapid AI advancements.

items.title: Multiple AI Startups and Tech Giants Announce Funding, Products, and Expansions
items.summary: On February 4, 2026, AI companies including those in enterprise governance, hardware, and physical security revealed new funding rounds, product lines, and strategic moves, highlighting the industry's acceleration toward autonomous workplace integration.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo Announces First Direct Partner Showcase of 2026 for February 5
items.summary: Nintendo has scheduled its first Direct of the year, a 30-minute Partner Showcase focusing on third-party games for Switch and Switch 2, airing at 9AM ET / 2PM GMT / 6AM PT. Expect updates on titles like The Duskbloods, Elden Ring, and Resident Evil Requiem.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase Confirmed for February 5, 2026
items.summary: The event will highlight upcoming third-party titles for Nintendo Switch and Switch 2, streaming live on YouTube and Nintendo apps with no first-party Nintendo games expected.

items.title: Deus Ex Remaster Delayed from February 5 Release
items.summary: The remaster of the original Deus Ex, planned for February 5, has been postponed to an unspecified date, amid a packed February release calendar.

items.title: Dragon Quest 7 Reimagined Releases Today on Multiple Platforms
items.summary: Dragon Quest 7 Reimagined launches on February 5 for Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2, and PlayStation 5, kicking off key February releases.

items.title: Nintendo Direct: Partner Showcase Set for February 5 at 6AM PT
items.summary: Nintendo's partner-focused presentation will showcase third-party games for Switch platforms, airing tomorrow with global timings announced.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
